intro: Gouania sericea, commonly known as silky gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its soft, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters. Gouania sericea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
